intro: Gleichenia mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' Gleichenia, is a species of fern belonging to the family Gleicheniaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features lanceolate, serrated leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of trichomes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest undergrowth. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds.
